TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AlertDialog extends Android.App.Dialog implements class Android.Content.IDialogInterface, class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: A subclass of Dialog that can display one, two or three buttons.

remarks.para:
The AlertDialog class takes care of automatically setting for you based on whether any views in the dialog return true from . Generally you want this set for a Dialog without text editors, so that it will be placed on top of the current input method UI. You can modify this behavior by forcing the flag to your desired mode after calling .
Developer Guides
For more information about creating dialogs, read the Dialogs developer guide.

Docs.summary: Construct an AlertDialog that uses an explicit theme.

remarks.para: Construct an AlertDialog that uses an explicit theme. The actual style that an AlertDialog uses is a private implementation, however you can here supply either the name of an attribute in the theme from which to get the dialog's style (such as or one of the constants , , or .

Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
